definition: to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book

sentences.english: This is a refraction of Marxist predictions.
sentences.chinese: 这是马克思主义预言的一种折光。

sentences.english: A refraction analysis method is used to determine spinning oil concentration.
sentences.chinese: 利用折光率快速测定纺丝油剂浓度。

sentences.english: A method for recovery of mixed solvent by measuring refractive index is reported in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 报道了一种通过测试折光率来回收混合溶剂的方法。

sentences.english: This main effect on height survey EDM is atmospheric refraction.
sentences.chinese: 大气折光是限制EDM测高精度的主要因素。

sentences.english: Attractive cherry red color with violet shimmer.
sentences.chinese: 醉人的樱桃红泛着紫色的折光。

sentences.english: Because of its ultra-fine crystal structure and high refractive index, it make color more abundance and satiation .
sentences.chinese: 微细晶体结构特性和高折光率，使色彩更显丰富饱满。

definition: to reflect/reflection (from a mirror etc)/reflex (i.e. automatic reaction of organism)
